acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This item came to the Library of Virginia in shipments of court papers from Powhatan County.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Samuel B. and Francis O. Drake General Store was located in the town of Macon, Virginia, and conducted business during the mid-19th century.
The blotter was used as an exhibit in the chancery suit Executor of Francis O. Drake versus Administrator of Samuel B. Drake heard in the Powhatan County Circuit Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Samuel B. and Francis O. Drake Blotter, 1840-1845, a general store, that served as a daybook. It records daily events and transactions in chronological order. Information recorded in the daybook includes date of transaction, name of customer, form of transaction, items purchased, quantity of items purchased, and cost per item. Items sold include clothing, dry-goods, whiskey, candy, shaving soap, shot, gunpowder, combs, and chocolate.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For additional information see the Powhatan County Chancery Cause, Executor of Francis O. Drake versus Administrator of Samuel B. Drake available on the Library of Virginia's Chancery Records Index. The index number is 1850-008.
